place.name: LLANGYBI
place.gazetteerText: LLANGYBI, a parish in Lampeter district, Cardigan; 4 miles NE by N of Lampeter r. station. It has a postoffice under Carmarthen. Acres, 1,809. Real property, £807. Pop., 292. Houses, 60. The property is divided among a few. An ancient camp is at CastellGoedtref. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £60. Patron, alternately the Earl of Lisburne and Lord Carrington. The church is good; and there are an Independent chapel, and two Calvinistic Methodist chapels. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
